content.text: Interfaces are moving beyond the screen. Research is focusing on conversational AI, immersive environments, and pervasive search.
content.hook: One day, we won't 'search'; we'll just 'know'.

slides.title: Trending Research
items: Conversational Agents/Chatbots: Search through dialogue (e.g., ChatGPT, Gemini).
Collaborative Search: Multiple users searching together in real-time.
Cross-Device IR: Finishing a search on a phone that started on a laptop.
Affective IR: Adapting the interface based on the user's emotional state.

content.text: The shift from 'query-response' to 'turn-taking dialogue'. The system maintains state and context over multiple exchanges.
content.problem: Trust and Hallucination. If the interface is too human-like, users may trust it too much when it's wrong.

content.text: Information is everywhere. Searching via smart glasses, smart mirrors, or voice-only devices.
content.hook: Search is becoming an invisible layer of our environment.

content.description: Design a search interface for a surgeon wearing AR glasses during surgery. They need to find a patient's history without using their hands. Describe the interaction.

content.linkage: We've mastered how humans and machines interact over text. Now we enter the world of images, audio, and video.
content.preparation: Think about how you'd search for a specific song if you didn't know the lyrics.
